mods.note: - July 1939, from the Honourable the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to the Secretary to the Government of India, External Affairs Department,Simla. Order of deportation against Abdullah, British Indian subject, under the Muscat Order in Council. In compliance with the instructions contained in Article 22(6) of the Muscat Order in Council, I forward, herewith, the marginally cited papers in 1. Letter No. 1101 dated the 28th June 1939 and | connection with enclosures from the Political Agent, Muscat. I \ XM the order 2* Telegram No. 97 dated the 13th July 1939 from? the Political Resident, Bushire. ' 5 of deportation passed on a British Indian subject, Abdullah, under Article 22(1) of the Order. Copy of a letter No. 1101 dated the 28th June 1939 from the Political Agent, Muscat, to the Secretary to the Hon’ble the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire. I have the honour to forward for confirmation an order of deportation passed by the District Court against^one Abdullah a vagrant who found his way along the coast of Gwadur from Karachi. I request that confirmation be given telegraphically. ^CLOSURE IN INi , f FOREIG ' SECRETARY’S UT,u< 1 1A , , RECEIVED ' 1 ‘ 8 1 T -8-1939IN TffiS COlttT OF THE POLITICAL AGENT, MUSCAT. ^ Whereas Abdullah a British Indian subject has been sentenced to one month’s imprisonment for theft at Gtaadur and further has been represented by His Highness the Sultan of Muscat’s Sovernment at Smdur as a vagrant and whereas he lias failed to give security to be of good behaviour called upon to do so it is ordered that he be deported from Gwadur* Griven under my hand and seal of the Court this 28th June 1939* Sd/~ megihle Captain, District Magistrate & Session Judge, S3AL OF THE COURT OF THE DISTRICT Muscat. MAGISTRATE ,MUSCAT. Cop y of .proceedi ngs .oOilmiQal ikafl-NQ-£-3 .of .123S• Whereas a report has been received by me alleging that you are of bad character and that if allowed to remain a large are likely to cornet offences under the Indian Penal Code, I hereby call upon you to show Wuu, cause why you should not be called upon to give security to keep the peace and commit no offences under the Indian Penal Code. Sd/- T. Hickinbotham, 4.6.39. The proceedings have been explained to the man and he states that if he had money he would have left before now. He has nothing to say except that he can not find security. Sd/- T. Hickinbotham 4.6.39.^* ******** ;• c*0r 0 I heraby ordar x^bdullah to find two securities for good behaviour for n 3.20Q/- oach for a period of one year from this date or to be detained in raison for a like period. 3d/- T. Hickinbotham. 4.6*39. — ssAtaMs m , o £ m -. The man Abdullah has been sent to me by the Wall. He is without employment. He came from Karachi. He has been accused of several thefts. He is in my opinion undesirable especially as a British subject as every time a theft occurs he is suspected. He has been here about eight months. I consider that he is liable to comnit further thefts if allowed to remain here. Sd/- H.M. Ismail. 4.6.39. In my presence. Y.Hickinbothara 4.6.39. G.T.C. Political Resident, Bushire, Political Agent, Muscat, 00 97 Dated the 13th July 1939 Your letter No. 1101 of 28th July Confirmed. Britconsul.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Coll 25/32 'Order in Council: Muscat: Deportation and Expulsion Orders under Muscat Orders in Council'

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order from the back to the front.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the inside front cover with 1, and terminates at the last folio with 5; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: Correspondence relating to a case of deportation of a British Indian subject from Gwadur [Gwadar]. The papers give details of the criminal case proceedings (theft) and the deportation order made under The Muscat Order in Council, 1939.
